result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

w/ 22CM329
Standard conditions:
Add'l conditions:
*Revert to $2,000 cash bond if Deft. leave without completing*
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Deft. must participate and complete in treatment at any treatment as directed by the drug court team.
Deft. to only be released to representative of drug court or Dept. of Corrections.

Information filed/reading waived, Not guilty plea entered all Counts. 
Court addresses bail motion filed by Defense. Deft. currently seeking drug treatment.
